intro: Justicia fasciculata, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and somewhat woody. Justicia fasciculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
